snippet: Increasing obesity rates, inactivity and older maternal age are contributing to the rise in hypertension and, consequently, strokes, experts say.
abstract: Study in journal Obstetrics & Gynecology finds stroke rate is rising rapidly among pregnant women, even as it is declining in Americans age 65 and older; contributing factors to hypertension and strokes include rising obesity rates, inactivity and older maternal age.
lead_paragraph: Increasing obesity rates, inactivity and older maternal age are contributing to the rise in hypertension and, consequently, strokes, experts say.

headline.main: Strokes Found Rising in Pregnant Women
headline.print_headline: Strokes Found Rising in Pregnant Women
